name: Lea Thompson
description: American actress and director known for her role in 'Back to the Future'.

content.title: Biography
content.body: Lea Thompson was born on May 31, 1961, in Rochester, Minnesota, USA. She began her career in the entertainment industry as a dancer, but turned to acting after moving to New York City. Thompson gained early recognition for her work on both television and film during the 1980s.

content.title: Career
content.body: Lea Thompson is best known for her role as Lorraine Baines McFly in the *Back to the Future* trilogy. Her performance in the franchise cemented her status as a household name. Thompson has appeared in numerous films throughout the 1980s and 1990s, including *All the Right Moves* (1983), *Some Kind of Wonderful* (1987), and *Howard the Duck* (1986). Beyond acting, Thompson has directed several television episodes and films, showcasing her versatility in the industry.

content.title: Notable Collaborations
content.body: Lea Thompson frequently collaborated with director Robert Zemeckis and producer Steven Spielberg. Her role in *Back to the Future* connected her with a stellar cast, including Michael J. Fox and Christopher Lloyd.

content.title: Legacy
content.body: Lea Thompson's impact on the film industry is significant, particularly due to her iconic role in the *Back to the Future* series. She has been recognized for her ability to bring warmth and depth to her characters. Thompson continues to influence new generations both in front of and behind the camera.
